summary: Four top tech executives have joined the U.S. Army Reserve as lieutenant colonels, skipping basic training and stepping directly into roles aimed at helping modernize the military . The initiative is part of a push by the Army to bring in private-sector innovation and reshape how the service approaches technology, talent, and modernization .  Detachment 201 is being created to bring in tech innovation executives to help the Army . Unlike traditional recruits, these executives will not attend boot camp . They will go through an express training program that covers marksmanship, physical fitness, Army history, and protocols .  The new officers will work on “targeted projects to help guide rapid and scalable tech solutions to complex problems” This marks another move by the Trump administration to align more closely with Silicon Valley . Palantir,Anduril, and other defense tech startups have increasingly become major players in national security .  Direct commissioning has been used to bring in specialized talent, such as doctors or chaplains, during times of war . This move represents a peacetime shift aimed at long-term transformation .  Palantir, Meta, OpenAI, and Thinking Machines just had their Executives Sworn Into The US Army Reserve . Palantirs, Meta and other AI-powered machines have been sworn in to the US Army Reserves .

President Donald Trump is committed to facilitating a rebirth of America's nuclear energy industry . NuScale Power is a leading developer of small modular reactors . Constellation Energy is the largest provider of nuclear power in the United States .  NuScale Power is developing small modular reactors that offer a variety of advantages over conventional nuclear power plants . With $491 million in cash and no debt, the company is on strong financial footing, an appealing situation for those looking to balance a quality growth stock .  NuScale Power says it's the only near-term deployable SMR company with design approval from the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission . Constellation Energy's portfolio includes natural gas, oil, hydroelectric, wind, and solar generation .  Constellation signed a 20-year PPA for nuclear energy that will be generated at the Clinton Clean Energy Center in Illinois . The company is the largest uranium producer based on market capitalization on American stock exchanges .  Cameco stands to benefit as the pathway for developing uranium assets . In 2024, Cameco reported uranium production of 23.4 million pounds . As of the end of 2024, the company reported 457 million pounds of proven and probable reserves . Cameco has the potential to profit from SMR producers like Kairos Power and TerraPower .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . The Motley Fool’s total average return is994% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Don’t miss out on the latest top 10 list, available when you joinStock Advisor .  The Motley Fool recommends Cameco and NuScale Power . Constellation Energy, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft are among the three companies mentioned in this article .

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said on Tuesday that AI will lead to job cuts at his own company . Microsoft declined to confirm the layoffs to Yahoo Finance . The news comes as the two companies invest billions in artificial intelligence efforts .  Some of Amazon's corporate employees are facing an order to relocate closer to their managers and teams . The mandate would require many of them to move across the US to Seattle, Washington DC and other hubs . The comments were met withbacklash from employees .  Amazon has projected it will spend $105 billion on AI infrastructure in 2025 . Microsoft is set to spend $80 billion in 2025 to build out AI data centers . Amazon and Microsoft have both announced layoffs in recent years .  A report last year estimated that generative AI was set to automate nearly 25% of jobs across all industries . Generative AI is set to be set to take over nearly a quarter of all jobs across the globe .
